product_name: Hero CosmeticsRescue Balm +Red Correct Post-Blemish Recovery Cream
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsGive BackRescue Balm +Red Correct Post-Blemish Recovery Cream from Hero Cosmetics - Intensive Nourishing and Calming for Dry, Red-Looking Skin After a Blemish - Dermatologist Tested.
details: DetailsBenefitsSoothes skin after a blemishWorks as a tinted primer & color-correctorFor medium to medium-deep skin tonesKey IngredientsApricot Encapsulated Pigments: Camouflage dark spotsBeta Glucan + Oligopeptides: Restore & replenishPanthenol: Soothes post-blemish skinFormulated WithoutDyePEGParabensItem 2599903How To UseApply as the last step in your AM skincare routine over SPF, or as a tone-evening primer under makeup.PRO TIP: A little goes a long way, dab a dot on blemished spots. For bigger areas, start with a pea-sized amount, blend out, and watch the color-changing pigments work their magic.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Dipropylene Glycol, Isononyl Isononanoate, Butylene Glycol, Octyldodecanol, Diethylhexyl Carbonate, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Polyglyceryl-3 Polyricinoleate, Silica, Panthenol, Sodium Chloride, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Mica, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Hydrogenated Polydecene, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Polyglyceryl-4 Diisostearate/Polyhydroxystearate/Sebacate, Beta-Glucan, Tocopheryl Acetate, Spirulina Platensis Powder, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Fruit Powder, rh-Polypeptide-1, rh-Oligopeptide-1, rh-Oligopeptide-2, rh-Polypeptide-62, rh-Polypeptide-3, Allantoin, Glycerin, Synthetic Beeswax, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Propylene Carbonate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Acrylates/Ammonium Methacrylate Copolymer, Xanthan Gum, Caprylyl Glycol, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Diglycerin, Aluminum Hydroxide, Boron Nitride, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Chromium Oxide Greens (CI 77288).
how_to_use: Apply as the last step in your AM skincare routine over SPF, or as a tone-evening primer under makeup.PRO TIP: A little goes a long way, dab a dot on blemished spots. For bigger areas, start with a pea-sized amount, blend out, and watch the color-changing pigments work their magic.

reviews.headline: NEW FORMULA IS BAD
reviews.comments: The old formula was a cult classic favorite for this red-faced gal. The new formula is greasy and doesn't have any coverage. I won't be purchasing it again! I recommend everyone send a note using the Contact Us form on Hero's website. Maybe we can get them to bring it back?

reviews.headline: Nope
reviews.comments: I loved this so much, until it broke me out in hives. DO NOT get this if you have sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: Did I miss a change with this product?
reviews.comments: Wondering about the rescue balm with red correct formula changes. I have been a avid user of this product and can't rave enough about it. It had become increasingly hard to find in my local stores, so I placed and online order for several tubes(through Ulta). The product I received was not ole faithful, the texture was different(more like a silky primer instead of creamy), and the coverage was much less. The new  tubes, while still showing the same volume was in it, was slightly smaller as I compared to the many older tubes I have around. Is this a formula, change? If so, it makes me sad! The older product was far superior.

reviews.headline: BRING BACK THE OLD FORMULA
reviews.comments:
I have used this ever day for probably about 4 or so years. I have acne prone skin. The old formula soothed my blemishes while also adding a little bit of coverage and color correcting the redness. The result was a nice moisturized glow. 

This new formula is completely different and I hate it :-(. It does not color correct my redness, and offers no blemish coverage either. It's almost like there is less encapsulated pigments in this formula. To make it worse, this new formula makes my already oily skin SO shiny. I was a die hard fan for so long and now I can't use this product anymore since it does absolutely nothing for my skin.

reviews.headline: :( new formula
reviews.comments: PLEASE bring back the original formula. I was so disappointed when I got a new tube. I used it and it seemed gritty and the color is basically yellow. It's beyond usable for me. This was my all time favorite product ðŸ˜©

reviews.headline: New formula is trash
reviews.comments: I loved this product, searched long and hard for redness correcting, found this and fell in love. Just bought the "new" formula and will be returning as soon as I can. It's not a new formula, it's a different product and its greasy, doesn't blend. No

reviews.headline: Reformulation ruined it!
reviews.comments:
I bought a new tube and had no idea they have changed it so drastically. It's now runny, provides zero redness reduction and feels so oily on my skin. It's so drastically different I was shocked. They even slightly changed the wording on the tube but not enough to let buyers know they changed all things that were good about it! 

Wish I could return it but I've already tossed the box. Such a waste and terrible change to such a great product for those with rosacea or redness. Disappointing!

reviews.headline: BRING BACK THE OLD FORMULA! ðŸ˜©
reviews.comments: The original formula has been my every day go to for YEARS! I mean I buy multiple at a time to make sure I don't run out. Well, I ran out and this new formula is HORRIBLE. It covers nothing, actually makes me more red! Bring back the old please ðŸ˜©ðŸ˜©

reviews.headline: New Formula Ruined It
reviews.comments: The original formal worked so well! The new formula does nothing for my skin.  I'm really hoping they'll change it back.

reviews.headline: New formula is awful!
reviews.comments: I have absolutely loved this product for years! It was one of the only products that gave great coverage for acne scars without making my sensitive skin breakout. However, this new formula is greasy, barely color corrects, and is incredibly thin. Bring back the old formula!!

reviews.headline: New Formula ðŸ˜«
reviews.comments:
I have been using this product for years! It was my every day product and they changed the formula and i was highly disappointed. 
Will have to find a new product.

reviews.headline: New formula is not good
reviews.comments: Please bring back the old formula. This new one turns my skin orange immediately. I loved this product for years!! What happened with this new formula??

reviews.headline: Reformulation ruined this product
reviews.comments: This was my base for my makeup since it came out. It blended beautifuly and covered all my redness perfectly. This new formula is trashy and doesnt cover ANYTHING. Just makes me look like a greaseball with redness. So dissapointed in Hero for changing this formula to something awful. Bring back the old formula!! Will be returning the new ones.

reviews.headline: New formula is TERRIBLE!!!!
reviews.comments: I have recommended this product for years on rosacea forums and it is my holy grail...however, this new formula is terrible! It is thinner and turns brown before it ever hits my face. It breaks me out also and the old formula did not. I am SO disappointed!

reviews.headline: The new formula is horrible.
reviews.comments: This was my daily product since it came out but the new formula is the complete opposite of what it was. I would apply spf, then this product and I would be ready to go out the door. All my redness and red spots would be covered just enough without looking or feeling like foundation. Now it feels like I am rubbing lip gloss all over my face and the tint does not show up. So it's just a clear, greasy mess. Sad to say I will have to look for an alternative product.

reviews.headline: The new formula has RUINED the product
reviews.comments: I have loyally used this product for the past 3 years. I loved it, it was a staple in my routine. Sadly I have to retire it now, because it makes my face extremely sticky and does not blend well at all. It was perfect before. Now, it is ruined and I'm very upset.

reviews.headline: New formula is not good.
reviews.comments: Old formula was amazing!!! New formula doesnt last as long and has a slighty orange tint once blended in

reviews.headline: Nope.
reviews.comments: I was looking for a redness corrector for the bridge of my nose and around my nostrils. This one was disappointing. Felt like straight up chapstick on my skin and when i started to blend, it disappeared losing its purpose. Nice concept but this is a miss. Back to searching

reviews.headline: I LOVED this product... BEFORE they changed the formula :(
reviews.comments: So disappointed when I went to repurchase my 4th empty of this product it was labeled "new formula"... NEW with NO coverage and for pale girls you will be orange, no more light green/olive tint to mask redness. OILY, GRAINY and never dries down :(

reviews.headline: New Formula - Drastic Change
reviews.comments: The new formula is very watered down and does not have the color correcting effect as the prevjos formula. This was my holy grail and I will not be purchaisng it no lonver.

media.headline: I LOVED this product... BEFORE they changed the formula :(
Not for the pale people
media.caption: Not for the pale people. Yellow/Orange hue once blended.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I started getting really bad rosacea in my later 20s. I was never big into makeup and skin care - my sister gave me a few things to try and i samples some things store employees recommended but everything just made it look worse but making it still red but now looked like i was obviously trying to cover it up in a gross way. 

In my 30s i decided to do something about it and jumped into the wonderful world of skincare and in tandem - makeup. While trying to tame the flair ups, i tried to find something to cover it up - foundation, skin tints, concealer - all the products marketed to solve my problem didnt. They all made it look worse stillâ€¦until I found this product from Hero. I found a tiny travel size and thought what can it hurt, ive tried everything else. I honestly couldnt believe it when i put it on after my morning skin care. I cried i was so happy - dramatic, sure, but trueâ€¦if you have rosecea flair up that have taken over your reality then you might get it. 

This magical elixir tamed the redness in my face while also looking like my skin and didn't make it feel like i had tons of make up on.  this product literally gave me back my confidence while i work diligently to get my skin barrier as healed as possible while living wirh rosacea. 

I also can use it as a primer and then top it with one of the good skin tint products ive found over time for more coverage, but even when just running to the store i throw this on quickly and poof, im no longer so self conscious of my bring red, splotchy face and i feel like a human again.  

Besides the expensive Erborian version, which is pretty solid, but heavily scented and I cant afford, this one doesnt turn me orange like other renditions of this product that are in a similar price point. 

Only issue: i wish it came in bigger bottles
faceoff_positive.headline: Life. Changing.

faceoff_negative.comments:
The new formula takes a former holy grail product and completely ruins each and every one of its good qualities. 

The old formula was thin, easy to blend, and highly pigmented; it would only oxidize very slightly when drying, which on my skin tone resulted in a very natural coverage for blemishes. It was better for me than the straight green concealers due to its paint-like consistency and lighter color. I loved being able to use it as a standalone replacement for foundation/concealer on acne and red marks, to give my skin a break from having to put on full makeup. Plenty of days I would just dab on some of the old formula and my skin would look clear all day, but could also add makeup on top of it if I wanted and still benefit from the color correction on my acne underneath.

The new formula has the consistency of Neosporin, with an inexplicable grainy texture in the mix. It is sticky and sheer with barely any pigment, so there's almost no actual color correction for red spots. It is also nigh-unblendable and never fully dries. What it DOES do is oxidize into a dark orange immediately upon spreading.  So far from having a high-coverage, color correcting alternative to concealer, you get to have sheer, wet/shiny, sticky, orange spots on your face, which will immediately wipe off if touched at all.

Plain green concealer has never worked for me, and I loved this product bc it offered both color correction and skin-healing benefits with an extremely natural finish. Now I've got to start over on finding a light-green color corrector with high coverage that dries to a natural finish and doesn't make my acne worseâ€¦what a huge bummer after having to search to long to find the old Hero balm in the first place. I never write reviews but couldn't let this one go.

Photos attached of the new vs old formula in swatches and used as coverup for a scab on my arm as an example.
faceoff_negative.headline: BRING HER BACK
